generation

Enum CardinalDirection

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<CardinalDirection>
      • generation.CardinalDirection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<CardinalDirection>

    public enum CardinalDirection
extends java.lang.Enum<CardinalDirection>
    Represents absolute directions as for a map to match with the orientation on the screen, i.e. North is no the top of the screen. In addition to limit the set of possible values, this enum supports operations such as rotateClockwise and getOppositeDirection. Translation methods between cardinal directions and dx,dy pairs are supported to facilitate its integration in current code base. Current mapping between cardinal directions and (dx,dy) east = (1,0) south = (0,1) west = (-1,0) north = (0,-1) Status: March 2016, coded, working but north/south upside down in graphics Inconsistency: Cells.java: (0,0) at top-left corner, y coordinate increases downwards MapDrawer: (0,0) at bottom-left corner, y coordinate increases upwards
    Author:
    pk

      Gives the opposite direction which is the same as applying a 180 degree rotation.
